description: From Middle French pretensse, from Late Latin praetēnsus (past participle of praetendō (“to pretend”), from prae- (“before”) + tendō (“to stretch”)).

entries.meaning: (British spelling) An act of pretending or pretension; a false claim or pretext.
examples: In pilot work we have used the method described in Experiment 2 on children′s memory for the content of their own false beliefs and pretence and asked them to differentiate between belief and pretence.

entries.meaning: Something asserted or alleged on slight evidence; an unwarranted assumption.
